write_up: One of Bladee’s most disrespected talents is his feel for innovative songwriting, how to work the hooks and the specific volume of his layered autotune-heavy vocal tracks over the minimalistic imprint of the production. It’s pop music at its very best. The opening synths, made by longtime collaborator Whitearmor, are some of the most emotionally illuminating sounds I’ve ever heard in music. Yes, it’s objectively meaningless, just like the vocals, but when it’s all put together so skillfully, it’s revelatory like nothing else out there.
lyric: Heard you say you wanna die, so do I
